alert.note: Alert for Morris (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 05 at 2:18AM CDT until July 05 at 4:45AM CDT by NWS Topeka
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM CDT THIS MORNING... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east central Kansas, including the following county, Morris. * WHEN...Until 1100 AM CDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 217 AM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 4 and 7.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Council Grove, White City, Wilsey, Parkerville and Council Grove Lake.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
